162

Growing gregariously on fallen Northern Red Oak log in open, west-facing, mixed oak/hickory woodland slope.

Cap visid and adorned with scales that become sparse at maturity. Young mushroom with partial veil. Older specimens drab in color while young mushrooms are plug colored. Stipe yellow with scabers near base.

KOH - yellow on the pileipellis of mature specimens and green-olive on young specimen. Red to yellow on stipe and hymenium.
